marketNews.title: China Plans Fiscal Stimulus Without Key Details
marketNews.content: Chinese Finance Minister Lan Fo'an seemed to be testing investor patience last Saturday (10/12) when he announced plans to release a fiscal stimulus package without major details. Analyst and investor consensus previously expected Lan to announce a fiscal stimulus value of 2 trillion yuan or 283 billion US dollars in a briefing last weekend. Bloomberg reported that details related to these stimuli would likely only be announced at the end of October 2024 after review by the National People's Congress. Although the value was not disclosed, Lan explained several fiscal stimulus plans that the Chinese government will release in the near future, including issuing more debt securities to help local governments, supporting the property sector, and increasing banking capital. Here are the details: The central government of China will issue more debt securities to ease debt pressure at the local government level. This is aimed at enabling local governments to focus more on helping their regional economies. Local governments can use funds obtained from their special bonds to purchase unsold houses and convert them into subsidized housing. Officials from the Chinese Ministry of Finance stated that there is significant room for the central government to increase debt and fiscal deficit. The largest State-Owned Banks in China will receive assistance to replenish their capital. This step was taken to relieve capital pressure after the People's Bank of China (PBoC) announced a significant reduction in mortgage interest rates and cut its policy interest rate to revive the economy. Bloomberg reported that no new stimulus related to consumption incentives was conveyed by Lan in the briefing. Furthermore, Lan did not detail subsidies for households. Following this news, the stock market responded with mixed results, with the SSE Composite Index and CSI300 Real Estate Index closing higher at +2.07% and +3.94% respectively on Monday (10/14), while the Hang Seng Index weakened by -0.75%. On the same day, the yuan to US dollar exchange rate weakened by -0.18%. The announcement delivered by Lan came just one day before China's national statistics bureau announced that the Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation in September 2024 was unchanged month-on-month and eased to 0.4% YoY (vs. August 2024: 0.4% MoM and 0.6% YoY inflation), lower than the consensus expectation which predicted 0.4% MoM and 0.6% YoY inflation. Core inflation was unchanged month-on-month and eased to 0.1% YoY (vs. August 2024: 0.4% MoM and 0.3% YoY inflation), lower than the consensus expectation which predicted 0.4% MoM inflation. China's annual core inflation in September 2024 was the lowest since February 2021. Key Takeaway: There are 2 potential implications of China's stimulus developments for Indonesia. From the financial market aspect, the attractiveness of the Chinese market in the eyes of foreign investors may decrease if the magnitude of the anticipated Chinese stimulus does not meet consensus expectations. This could reverse the outflow trend from several countries - including Indonesia - that has occurred recently. From an economic aspect, the success of the stimulus in aiding China's economic recovery has the potential to positively impact the exports of several Indonesian commodities, such as coal, CPO, copper, and nickel.

marketNews.title: Correction: Regarding the potential increase in cement consumption due to housing construction plans in the new government era
marketNews.content: Correction: On Friday (10/11), the Key Takeaway in the Stockbit Snips headline stated that the plan to build 3 million houses per year during the Prabowo Subianto administration has the potential to increase cement consumption by up to 60 million tons per year, equivalent to 94% of domestic cement consumption realized during 2023. This calculation was inaccurate, with the more precise potential cement consumption increase being 6 million tons per year or equivalent to 9.4% of domestic cement consumption realized during 2023. The error has been corrected on the Stockbit Snips website.

marketNews.title: National Coal Production in 9M24 is below the RKAB plan
marketNews.content: National coal production during 9M24 rose +0.7% YoY to 624.16 million tons, equivalent to 67.7% of the 2024 RKAB production plan of 922.14 million tons. Based on this realization, the Executive Director of the Indonesia Mining Association, Hendra Sinadia, stated that national coal production in 2024 will be below the RKAB production plan.

marketNews.title: US Producer Price Index (PPI) inflation eased in September 2024
marketNews.content: The US Bureau of Labor Statistics noted that Producer Price Index (PPI) inflation in the US eased to 1.8% YoY in September 2024 (vs. August 2024: 1.9% YoY inflation). This result surpassed the consensus expectation which predicted 1.6% YoY inflation, but marked the lowest level in the last 7 months. Monthly, PPI was unchanged in September 2024 (vs. August 2024: 0.2% MoM inflation), lower than the consensus expectation which predicted 0.1% MoM inflation. Meanwhile, core PPI rose 0.2% MoM in September 2024 (vs. August 2024: 0.3% MoM inflation), in line with expectations. Annual core PPI inflation rose to 2.8% YoY (vs. August 2024: 2.6% YoY inflation), exceeding the consensus expectation of 2.7% YoY.

marketNews.title: President-elect Prabowo Subianto is considering offering a cabinet seat to current Finance Minister Sri Mulyani
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that President-elect Prabowo Subianto is considering offering a cabinet seat to the current Finance Minister, Sri Mulyani. Reuters sources mentioned that Sri Mulyani could be asked to remain as Finance Minister or take the position of Coordinating Minister for the Economy. Representatives for Sri Mulyani and Prabowo have not commented on this issue, while the Ministry of Finance declined to comment. Previously, Prabowo stated last week that he would likely retain many ministers from President Joko Widodo's cabinet.

tickerNews.title: ASII: Automotive Wholesales Fell -15.2% YoY in 9M24
tickerNews.content: Astra International recorded domestic motor vehicle wholesales of 40,096 units (-9% YoY, -5% MoM) in September 2024. This result was in line with the growth of industry-wide vehicle wholesales, so ASII's market share remained relatively stable at 55.2% in September 2024 (vs. September 2023: 55.1%, August 2024: 55.3%). The weakening of ASII's vehicle wholesales was mainly pressured by a drop in Daihatsu sales to 12,676 units (-15.5% YoY, -8.3% MoM), while Toyota+Lexus sales were relatively better at 25,591 units (-2.2% YoY, -2.3% MoM). For 9M24, ASII's vehicle wholesales dropped -15.2% YoY to 357,802 units, with a market share of 56.5% (vs. 9M23: 55.8%).

tickerNews.title: Government may relax copper concentrate export relaxation for subsidiary of AMMN and Freeport Indonesia
tickerNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated that the government will likely reintroduce export relaxation for copper concentrate to Amman Mineral Internasional's subsidiary, PT Amman Mineral Nusa Tenggara, and PT Freeport Indonesia. Bahlil mentioned that the duration of this export relaxation would be around 1-2 months after the currently effective export relaxation expires in December 2024. This discussion is being considered because the copper cathode smelters built by both companies cannot yet operate at 100% capacity by the end of this year. Bahlil stated that the volume quota for copper concentrate exports to be granted will be the difference between the production volume that cannot yet be absorbed by the smelters.

tickerNews.title: MDKA is preparing a bankable feasibility study for the Tujuh Bukit copper project, to become Indonesia's 3rd largest copper mine
tickerNews.content: General Manager of Communications for Merdeka Copper Gold, Tom Malik, stated that the company is compiling a bankable feasibility study for the Tujuh Bukit copper project in Banyuwangi, East Java. Tom mentioned that the project recorded an increase in mineral resources based on the latest estimates as of March 2024, so the copper content in the Tujuh Bukit copper project increased from 8.1 million tons to 8.2 million tons, with gold content increasing from 27.4 million ounces to 27.9 million ounces. Copper mining in Tujuh Bukit will commence after the gold mine above it finishes operations in 2029. Tom stated that the Tujuh Bukit copper project will become the 3rd largest copper mine in Indonesia and has the potential to increase national copper production by +10-15%.

tickerNews.title: PYFA targets acquisition of 7 pharmaceutical companies to boost 2025 revenue by over +50% YoY
tickerNews.content: Pyridam Farma Management stated in a public expose that the company is targeting the acquisition of other pharmaceutical companies to gain access to new products and markets. PYFA management mentioned that there are currently 7 potential companies for acquisition, consisting of 1 company from Indonesia, 3 from Australia, 1 from the Philippines, 1 from Myanmar, and 1 from Malaysia. This inorganic growth strategy is expected to boost revenue by more than +50% YoY in 2025, compared to relying solely on organic growth. Previously, PYFA acquired the Australian pharmaceutical company, Probiotec Limited, for 252 million Australian dollars in mid-2024.

tickerNews.title: TPIA signs MOU with Pertamina International Shipping for feasibility study on cooperation in chemical, bitumen, and shipping/maritime logistics
tickerNews.content: Chandra Asri Pacific, through its subsidiary, PT Chandra Shipping International, signed a memorandum of understanding with PT Pertamina International Shipping to explore a feasibility study for potential cooperation in the chemical, bitumen, and other maritime transportation or logistics fields. This potential cooperation is expected to enhance efficiency and global reach in maritime transportation and logistics.

tickerNews.title: TKIM injected capital of IDR 300 billion into subsidiary PT Sumalindo Hutani Jaya (SHJ)
tickerNews.content: Pabrik Kertas Tjiwi Kimia announced that it has injected capital amounting to 300 billion rupiah into its subsidiary, PT Sumalindo Hutani Jaya (SHJ). This transaction is intended to support the business activities of SHJ, which operates in the integrated industrial forest sector.

tickerNews.title: BYD's wholesale car sales in September 2024 fell -29% MoM, market share dropped to 2.9%
tickerNews.content: Gaikindo noted that BYD's car wholesale sales in September 2024 dropped -29% MoM to 2,075 units, resulting in BYD's market share falling to 2.9% (vs. August 2024: 3.9%). Cumulatively during 9M24, BYD's car wholesale sales reached 8,536 units, with a market share of 1.3% (vs. 8M24: 1.2%).

tickerNews.title: HATM announced the purchase of one bulk carrier ship and has ended a one-ship lease agreement with CBRE
tickerNews.content: Habco Trans Maritima (HATM) announced the purchase of 1 unit of a bulk carrier ship for 13.8 million US dollars from Seacon Peru Ltd., financed using a loan facility from a financial institution and internal cash. The acquisition is intended to increase HATM's carrying capacity and accommodate commodity shipping market needs. Previously, HATM announced that it had terminated a 1-unit vessel lease agreement with Cakra Buana Resources Energi (CBRE).

tickerNews.title: AMAN Controlling Shareholder and President Commissioner Johan Tedja Surya increased his stake in AMAN
tickerNews.content: The controller and President Commissioner of Makmur Berkah Amanda (AMAN), Johan Tedja Surya, purchased approximately 2.4 million AMAN shares at an average price of 109 rupiah per share on October 8, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 265 million rupiah. Following this transaction, Johan Tedja Surya's ownership in AMAN increased from 4.1% to 4.16%.
